citation.article-title: Monoclonal antibodies for the identification of Borrelia afzelii sp. nov. assocciated with late cutaneous manifestations of Lyme borreliosis

p.s: Description of Borrelia afzelii sp. nov.
Borrelia afzelii (af'ze.li.i. M.L. gen. n. afzelii in honor of Arvid Afzelius (25), a Swedish physician who was the first to report the skin lesion characteristic of Lyme borreliosis in 1909)
It has also been referred to as group VS461 in a previous study (17).
The morphology of the genus has been described previously (26).
Cultural properties as described previously for B. burgdorferi sensu lato (27), and rRNA gene restriction patterns after digestion by EcoRV (17) contain 3 fragments (6.7, 3.2, and 1.6 kb).
After digestion by HindIII rRNA gene restriction pattern contain 5 fragments (3.7, 2.1, 1.5, 0.9, and 0.6 kb) (17).
An additional fragment of 1.7 kb was present for the strain Ip21 (unpublished data).
Reactivity with I 17.3 and J 8.3 was noted but no reactivity in Western blots with MAbs H3TS, H5332, H6831, and D6.
The G + C content of the DNA was 27 to 28 mol% (unpublished data).
The type strain is VS461 strain (= CIP 103469), isolated from Ixodes ricinus in Switzerland.
The type strain has all the characteristics described above for the species.
The G + C content of the DNA is 28 mol% (unpublished data).
